title: Greg Gianforte
deleted: The foundation also regularly sponsors many of the arts in Montana, including MSU's free and public 'Shakespeare in the Parks', a traveling shakespear performance bringing arts to rural Montanans. The family foundation also sponsors events such  as the Bozeman Symphony and the Intermountain Opera Association.

title: Greg Gianforte
added: Gianforte believes in [[Young Earth creationism]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ncse.com/cej/6/2/scientific-creationism-as-pseudoscience|title="Scientific" Creationism as a Pseudoscience - NCSE|website=ncse.com|access-date=June 22, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/25/us/greg-gianforte-facts.html|title=Who Is Greg Gianforte?|first=Alexander|last=Burns|date=May 25, 2017|work=The New York Times|access-date=September 23, 2020}}</ref> He has donated at least $290,000 to the [[Glendive Dinosaur and Fossil Museum]], a Montana [[creationist museum]] which teaches visitors that the [[theory of evolution]] is false, that the Earth is about 6,000â€“6,400 years old, and that humans and dinosaurs coexisted during the same period of history.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ozy.com/rising-stars/can-greg-gianforte-save-montana-from-poverty/66611l_r=0|title=Can Greg Gianforte Save Montana From Poverty?|date=January 13, 2016|newspaper=Billings Gazette|last1=Walsh|first1=Meghan|access-date=January 13, 2016}}{{Dead link|date=January 2020 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The museum claims dinosaurs were aboard [[Noah's Ark]], and that they likely went extinct 4,300 years ago during the great flood described in the [[Book of Genesis]]. <ref name="dinosaur"/><!--NOTE: sources do not verify prior claims that Gianforte contributed more than $1,000,000 to the museum -- $290K in cash and the dinosaur exhibits, for which no value has been assigned.--><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2015/04/billionaire-tech-ceo-laying-groundwork-for-montana-gubernatorial-run/434625/|title=Billionaire Tech CEO Laying Groundwork for Montana Gubernatorial Run|last=Bruggeman|first=Karyn|work=The Atlantic|date=April 13, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Inbody|first=Kristen|url=http://www.greatfallstribune.com/story/life/my-montana/2016/04/28/dinosaurs-bible-glendive-museum/83681042/|title=Dinosaurs, the Bible and a Glendive museum|work=Great Falls Tribune|date=April 28, 2016|language=en}}</ref><ref name="dinosaur">{{cite web|url=http://billingsgazette.com/news/features/magazine/dinosaur-museum-presents-biblical-view-of-origins/article_1c9ac218-bab0-11de-84f1-001cc4c002e0.html|title=Dinosaur museum presents biblical view of origins: A faith-based Creation|last=Healy|first=Donna|date=October 18, 2009|issn=2372-868X|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130629215555/http://billingsgazette.com/news/features/magazine/dinosaur-museum-presents-biblical-view-of-origins/article_1c9ac218-bab0-11de-84f1-001cc4c002e0.html|archive-date=June 29, 2013|url-status=live|newspaper=Billings Gazette}}</ref> The Gianforte Family Foundation also donated a [[Tyrannosaurus rex]] skeleton replica to the museum.<ref name="dinosaur"/>
